intro: Galium taurinum, commonly known as Taurine Bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs and small, opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Galium taurinum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
